gbj_pythonlib_sw package¶

Submodules¶

gbj_pythonlib_sw.config module¶

Module for managing a configuration file.

class gbj_pythonlib_sw.config.Config(file)[source]¶

Bases: object

Create a manager for a configuration INI file.

A single class instance object manages just one configuration file. If more configuration files are needed to manage, separate instance should be created.

Parameters:file (string, pointer) – Full path to a configuration file or file pointer already opened file.
get_content()[source]¶

Create string with configuration parameters in form of INI file.

All section and options are listed including from DEFAULT section.

Returns:Concent of configuration file without comments.
Return type:str
option(option, section, default=None)[source]¶

Read configuration option’s value.

Parameters:
  • option (str) – Configuration file option to be read.
  • section (str) – Configuration file section to be read from.
  • default (str) – Default option value, if configuration file has neither the option nor the section.
Returns:

Configuration option value or default one.
Return type:

str
option_split(option, section, appendix=[], separator=', ')[source]¶

Read configuration option and append and split its value to tuple.

option – configuration file option to be read. section – configuration file section to be read from. appendix – list of additonal option value parts that should be added. separator – string for separating appendix list members and split

the entire option value

List with configuration option parts.

options(section)[source]¶

Read list of options in a section.

Parameters:section (str) – Configuration section to be read from.
Returns:List with configuration option names.
Return type:list of str

gbj_pythonlib_sw.mqtt module¶

Module for communicating with MQTT brokers.

class gbj_pythonlib_sw.mqtt.MQTT(config)[source]¶

Bases: object

Common MQTT management.

get_connected()[source]¶

Return boolena connection flag.

class gbj_pythonlib_sw.mqtt.MqttBroker(config)[source]¶

Bases: gbj_pythonlib_sw.mqtt.MQTT

Create MQTT client connecting to usually local MQTT broker.

  • The client utilizes MQTT topics and filter definitions from a configuration file.
GROUP_BROKER = 'MQTTbroker'¶
GROUP_FILTERS = 'MQTTfilters'¶
GROUP_TOPICS = 'MQTTtopics'¶
callback_filters(**kwargs)[source]¶

Register callback functions for particular MQTT topic groups.

key – the key of the argument dictionary is a configuration option
defining a topic, to which a topic filter is related.
value – the value of the argument dictionary is a tuple with callback
and section defining MQTT topic filter, if it is not GROUP_FILTERS, or just a callback, e.g.

server_test=mqtt_on_message_test server_sensor_temp=(mqtt_on_temp, ConfigMqtt.GROUP_TOPICS)

  • The method should be used before subscribing to respective filtered topics. The best place is in the on_connect callback.
  • The method can be called multiple times. For configuration option used at a previous call the filter callback is just updated. If the callback is None, the filter for correscponding topic is removed.
connect(**kwargs)[source]¶

Connect to MQTT broker and set callback functions and credentials.

All key for callback function are root words from MQTT client callbacks without prefix “on_”.

connect – callback launched after connection to MQTT broker disconnect – callback launched after disconnection from MQTT broker subscribe – callback launched after subscription to MQTT topics message – callback launched after receiving message from MQTT topics username – loging name of the registered user at MQTT broker password – password of the registered user at MQTT broker

disconnect()[source]¶

Disconnect from MQTT broker.

publish(message, option, section='MQTTtopics')[source]¶

Publish to a MQTT topic determined by configuration option.

message – data to be published option – configuration file option to be read section – configuration file section to be read from

General exception with error message

subscribe_filters()[source]¶

Subscribe to all MQTT topic filters.

General exception with error code

subscribe_topic(option, section='MQTTtopics')[source]¶

Subscribe to a MQTT topic determined by configuration option.

option – configuration file option to be read section – configuration file section to be read from

General exception with error code

topic_def(option, section='MQTTtopics')[source]¶

Return topic definition as a ‘topic,qos’ tuple.

topic_name(option, section='MQTTtopics')[source]¶

Return topic name from configuration MQTT topic definition.

topic_qos(option, section='MQTTtopics')[source]¶

Return topic QoS from configuration MQTT topic definition.

class gbj_pythonlib_sw.mqtt.ThingSpeak(config)[source]¶

Bases: gbj_pythonlib_sw.mqtt.MQTT

Connect and publish to ThingSpeak MQTT broker.

  • The client utilizes MQTT topics and filter definitions from a configuration file.
  • The class only provides single publishing to ThingSpeak, so that connecting and disconnecting to the ThingSpeak broker is automatic.
GROUP_BROKER = 'ThingSpeak'¶
OPTION_CHANNEL_ID = 'channel_id'¶
OPTION_MQTT_API_KEY = 'mqtt_api_key'¶
OPTION_PUBLISH_DELAY = 'publish_delay'¶
OPTION_WRITE_API_KEY = 'write_api_key'¶
get_publish_delay()[source]¶

Return current publish delay limit in seconds.

publish(fields={}, status=None)[source]¶

Publish single message to the ThingSpeak MQTT broker.

fields – dictionary with ThingSpeak channel field numbers and values
for publishing, e.g., {1: 23.4, 2: 1}

status – text to be published in the ThingSpeak channel as a status

  • If a field number is outside the range 1 ~ 8, this field is ignored.
  • If a value is undefined or empty, the corresponding field or status is ignored.

Boolean flag about real publishing to ThingSpeak General exception with error message from ThingSpeak

gbj_pythonlib_sw.statfilter module¶

Module for statistical filtering.

class gbj_pythonlib_sw.statfilter.StatFilter(value_max=None, value_min=None, buffer_len=5, decimals=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Creating a scuffolding for statistical filtering.

filter(value)[source]¶

Filter value against acceptable value range.

value – value to be filtered. If outside the value range, None is
returned.
get_buffer_len()[source]¶

Return real length of the data buffer.

  • Usually the returned value is the same as length put to the constructor.
  • If class has adjusted or limited the input buffer length, the method returns the actual length.
  • The method is useful, if the length has been put to the constructor as a numeric literal and there is no variable of the length to use it in other statements.
get_readings()[source]¶

Return current number of values in data buffer.

  • The statistical calculation can be provided beforeregistering the full data buffer. In that case the method returns the values, which a statistic is calculated from.
  • Usually the returned value should be the same as length of the data buffer at the end of a measurement cycle.
get_value_max()[source]¶

Return maximal acceptable value.

get_value_min()[source]¶

Return minimal acceptable value.

reset()[source]¶

Reset instance object to initial state.

result(value)[source]¶

Return rounded value if needed and possible.

set_buffer(buffer_len=5)[source]¶

Adjust data buffer for staticital filtering.

set_filter(**kwargs)[source]¶

Set acceptable value range.

value_max – maximal measuring value acceptable for filtering.
Default from constructor.
value_min – minimal measuring value acceptable for filtering.
Default from constructor.
class gbj_pythonlib_sw.statfilter.StatFilterExponential(factor=0.5, value_max=None, value_min=None, decimals=None)[source]¶

Bases: gbj_pythonlib_sw.statfilter.StatFilter

Exponential statistical filtering.

get_factor()[source]¶

Return smoothing factor.

result(value=None)[source]¶

Calculate and return statistically smoothed value.

value – sample value to be filtered. If None, recent filtered result
provided.
  • The method calculates a new filtered value from the input value, previous stored filtered value, and stored smoothing factor in the class instance object.
  • The very first input value is considered as a previous filtered value or starting value.
class gbj_pythonlib_sw.statfilter.StatFilterRunning(stat_type=0, value_max=None, value_min=None, buffer_len=5, decimals=None)[source]¶

Bases: gbj_pythonlib_sw.statfilter.StatFilter

Running statistics filtering.

get_stat_type()[source]¶

Return defaulting running statistics type.

result(value=None)[source]¶

Register new value and calculate default running statistic.

value – new sample value. If None, statistic is calculated from
current content of the data buffer.
  • The method calculates a new filtered value from the input value and previous stored sample values in the class instance object.
result_avg(value=None)[source]¶

Register new value and calculate running average.

value – new sample value. If None, statistic is calculated from
current content of the data buffer.
  • The method calculates new statistic from the input value and previous stored sample values in the class instance object.
result_max(value=None)[source]¶

Register new value and calculate running maximum.

value – new sample value. If None, statistic is calculated from
current content of the data buffer.
  • The method calculates new statistic from the input value and previous stored sample values in the class instance object.
result_med(value=None)[source]¶

Register new value and calculate running median.

value – new sample value. If None, statistic is calculated from
current content of the data buffer.
  • The method calculates new statistic from the input value and previous stored sample values in the class instance object.
  • Until the data buffer is full, the method calculates median high at even readings in the buffer.
result_min(value=None)[source]¶

Register new value and calculate running minimum.

value – new sample value. If None, statistic is calculated from
current content of the data buffer.
  • The method calculates new statistic from the input value and previous stored sample values in the class instance object.
set_stat_type(stat_type)[source]¶

Set running statistics type as a default for resulting.

stat_type – type of a statistic calculated from registered running
values by default in the method ‘result’. If not from allowed enumeration, nothing changes.

gbj_pythonlib_sw.timer module¶

Module for creating a timer and its prescalers.

class gbj_pythonlib_sw.timer.Timer(period=1, callback=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Creating a timer.

  • If it is created without defined count of shots, it is a periodic timer marked with “R” (repeating) in the string instance representation.
  • If it is created with count greater than 1, it is a countdown timer marked with “C” (countdown) in the string instance representation.
  • If it is created with count equal 1, it is an one-shot timer marked with “O” (oneshot) in the string instance representation.
get_prescalers()[source]¶

Return list of prescalers.

prescaler(factor, callback, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Register a callback function called at each factor tickself.

factor – integer divider of the initial timer period. It is truncated
to integer and ignored if less than 2.
callback – function or tuple of them calling by the timer
at each factor-th period

args – additional positional arguments passed to the callback

kwargs – additional keyworded arguments passed to the callback.

  • The prescaler method enables launching a specific callback at multiple timer period and acts as a frequency divider.
  • Prescale factor equal 1 is useless, because it is equivalent to basic timer callback. In this case it is ignored.
  • The prescaler method can be called multiple times. For the same factor the corresponding callback is updated including its arguments. If None, the prescaler is removed.
  • None of prescalers is launched if basic timer callback is defined or timer is one-timer one.
  • All prescalers are called at random order, but usually in order of their registration.
start()[source]¶

Create timer thread object and store it in the instance.

stop()[source]¶

Stop timer.

gbj_pythonlib_sw.timer.register_timer(name, timer=None)[source]¶

Store a timer object in the dictionary.

name – key name of a timer timer – value object of a timer. If name already exists in the dictionary,

the timer is update. If none and name already exists, the timer is stopped and removed from the dictionary.
gbj_pythonlib_sw.timer.start_timers()[source]¶

Start all registered timers.

gbj_pythonlib_sw.timer.stop_timers()[source]¶

Stop all registered timers.

gbj_pythonlib_sw.trigger module¶

Module for managing and executing triggers - value dependend callbacks.

class gbj_pythonlib_sw.trigger.Trigger[source]¶

Bases: object

Creating a trigger manager.

del_triggers(ids=[])[source]¶

Delete all or listed triggers.

ids – list of trigger identifiers that should be Removed

exec_triggers(value, ids=[])[source]¶

Evaluate and execute all or listed triggers.

value – comparison value ids – list of trigger identifiers that should be evaluated

value – comparison value threshold – threshold value

get_triggers()[source]¶

Return list of triggers.

set_trigger(id, mode=None, value=None, callback=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create or update trigger.

id – unique identifier of a trigger in the list of them of any type mode – processing mode of the trigger [UPPER, LOWER] value – threshold value callback – function or tuple of them calling at threshold value. args – additional positional arguments passed to the callback after

forced arguments by this class.

kwargs – additional keyworded arguments passed to the callback.

Exception NameError - if identifier is not provided Exception TypeError - if mode is not from the allowed enumeration

  • The trigger method can be called multiple times. For the same trigger value corresponding callback is updated including its arguments. If None, the trigger is removed.
  • For a particular threshold value only one trigger can be defined, either upper or lower, but not both.
